properties.Name: Oregon Landscapes
properties.Address: 724 SW Harrison St., Park Blocks side of Neuberger Hall
properties.Description: Hardy’s biggest piece, the bronze sculpture on the exterior of Neuberger Hall, took a year to complete. It depicts the landscape of Oregon from west to east with sea life, the coast range, the Willamette Valley, Cascades, and John Day Fossil Beds.

properties.Name: Functional Installations
properties.Address: 1914 SW Park Ave., Shattuck Hall, throughout the building (indoor location)
properties.Description: A series of functional, durable elements and site-specific works of art focused on material inquiry. The pieces are situated throughout the building in ‘art zones’ and communicate both visually and through the body.

properties.Name: Salmon Cycle
properties.Address: 710 SW Jackson St., west entrance of the Native American Student and Community Center
properties.Description: A tall marker depicting salmon migration and constructed using three trees killed in the eruption of Mt. St Helens.

properties.Name: Juicy II
properties.Address: 527 SW 6th Ave., on ceiling of Ondine stairwell (indoor location)
properties.Description: A colorful sculpture composed of reclaimed bottle caps and lids from cans and jars.

properties.Name: TECOTOSH
properties.Address: 1930 SW 4th Ave., in front of the Engineering Building
properties.Description: A curving abstract sculpture that illustrates the engineering principles of tension, compression, torsion and shear.

properties.Name: The Knowledge
properties.Address: SW 5th Ave., between SW Hall and College
properties.Description: A mural depicting books from Portland State University Millar Library. Book titles reflect education and sustainability efforts and were chosen by a poll of students, faculty and staff.

properties.Name: Urban Hydrology
properties.Address: SW 6th Ave., between SW Hall and Mill St.
properties.Description: Twelve oversized granite diatoms situated in bioswales reflect the environmental science research that takes place on campus.

properties.Name: Creation Myth
properties.Address: 1800 SW 6th Ave., Campus Recreation Center atrium (indoor location)
properties.Description: A unique artwork of kiln formed glass and iron in the form of a Viking ship. Pictographic compositions are set against symmetrical glass panels within the iron frame of the ship.

properties.Name: Urban Plaza Sculptures
properties.Address: SW Montgomery St., betwen 5th and 6th Ave., Urban Plaza
properties.Description: Granite blocks and accompanying shadows (stainless steel edged slabs) imply routes through the space and complement the direction of the TriMet system. The sculptures were created to be visually evident at ground level, and from the surrounding buildings.

properties.Name: Conduit
properties.Address: SW 6th Ave. & SW Mill St., side of University Services Building
properties.Description: A steel mural depicting the act of traveling as a metaphor for the transmission of ideas.

properties.Name: Score
properties.Address: 1620 SW Park Ave., Lincoln Hall north atrium (indoor location)
properties.Description: A series of ink saturated cotton cord sculptures molded into fluid and arresting forms. Score is inspired by the movement, flow and trial of performance, and evokes an organic choreography.

properties.Name: Cornelius, Zira and Friends in Hemispheres
properties.Address: 1825 SW Broadway, Smith Memorial Student Union, second floor (indoor location)
properties.Description: A series of abstract sculptures offers a glimpse of a transitory, liquid bubble time-frame contrasted with the solidity of earth and stones, just as the two are locked in an improbable dance.

properties.Name: Entrium Light Cloud
properties.Address: 1719 SW 10th Ave., Science Research and Teaching Center northeast and southeast entrances
properties.Description: Referencing organic and inorganic phenomenal patterns and inspired by the light-filtering effects and spatial layering formed by the arboreal canopies in the Park Blocks, the piece creates a compelling zone of passage into the building.

properties.Name: Knight of Tomorrow 574
properties.Address: SW Harrison St., between 10th and 11th Ave., Walk of the Heroines
properties.Description: The sculpture represents the heroism of all women by signifying an “everywoman” who has met the challenges of history and contemporary life.

properties.Name: Memorial Inscription
properties.Address: 1136 SW Montgomery St., east side of Epler
properties.Description: Seven granite benches and ten etched stainless steel panels give historical context to the life of Dr. Epler through the use of text and imagery. The panels are inspired by the grids and proportions of athletic fields, board games, and scrolls.

properties.Name: Cobbletale
properties.Address: 1705 SW 11th Ave., east side of Blumel
properties.Description: Historic cobblestones, unearthed during Blumel Hall’s construction, create a raised walkway that transforms the courtyard into a topographic landscape.

properties.Name: Fauxcilitator
properties.Address: 2730 SW Moody Ave., Collaborative Life Sciences Building atrium (indoor location)
properties.Description: Fauxcilitator is an invented word describing an imaginary power – the ability to elevate one’s mood through the exposure to the spectrum of daylight. The artwork is the hypothesis in an environment where speculation is part of the curriculum.
